website_summaries.verdict: A nice pair of work boots for light to mid-level jobs, warm-weather wear, and budget-conscious shoppers.
pros: Goodyear welt and nubuck leather provide a comfortable fit for most
Many wearers didn't require a break-in period
Customer service is helpful in addressing questions or concerns
cons: Boots do not have steel toes
Marginal insulation and a few longevity concerns

customer_reviews.title: These boots are pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these boots for work and I wear them about 14 hours a day and they have held up for 6 months which is about how long my boots normally last. They are soft and light which I prefer. I will probably buy them again which will be soon because this pair is nearly done.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: These boots were great for the first week then they break in and ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots were great for the first week then they break in and you have no ankle support. I’m sure they are fine for a home owner who wears them once every two weeks to do lawn work, but for a guy who works everyday in Remodeling they are terrible. I also need to add they leave black scuff marks on decking and flooring that are incredibly difficult to remove. These boots suck. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: laurence b olivieri

customer_reviews.title: Excelent for $40 boots
customer_reviews.text: Excelent for $40 boots. I ordered a 6.5 men size and it fits great. I am 8 in women size. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They base their boots on durability and lasting longer than the other guys, but that’s not the case
customer_reviews.text: Have had these boots for since the beginning of the year and they have already fallen apart. It’s not like I’m hard on them, barely get wet and still look new expect for the fact the stitching along the soles have all come out, very disappointed and would think Ever Boots would Want to fix this issue but I can’t get a response from them. They base their boots on durability and lasting longer than the other guys, but that’s not the case
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive . . but surprisingly . . . NOT a good value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pair of EVER BOOTS . . . these and another style . . based on the glowing reviews. I'm not going to purchase again. The leather is of decent quality, but the rest of the shoe suffers. Shoelaces....cheap! The thin band of rubber at the top....cheap! The quality overall is on par with the generic WalMart boots that look like boots, but don't perform like boots and are not comfortable. I swapped out the insoles for Timberland insoles, which helped reduce the feel of a ridge near the front of the heal of the shoe. I do not believe many of these glowing reviews are real. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bow

customer_reviews.title: Buy these now!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots I've owned. I'm a 25 yr auto mechanic and I've owned all the name brands. Wolverine and Timberland Pro have been the last two. I gave these a try and I'm impressed. Perfect fit and feel broken in straight out of the box. The sole grips better than any other on polished concrete floors. I added a pair of Walgreens memory foam insoles day one and I feel 10 yrs younger. Seriously. About to buy a 2nd pair to keep for the future...before price goes up! (I dyed mine black. Easy $7)
customer_reviews.author: WestTxMech

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 months amd fell apart
customer_reviews.text: These are the second pair I bought. Last one lasted exactly one year and sole separated so I bought a second pair Dec 20th but 5 months later May 2018 the sole once again fell off "both boots"(left and right). I tried to find a contact to Ever boot but kept getting sent back to Amazon. Very unhappy with this pair!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert darr

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I work construction and usually go through a pair of work boots every 9-12 months and typically spend $100-135. I was a bit skeptical when I saw the price on these, but after reading reviews I thought I would take a chance. I have been wearing them for a week and I gotta say they were the easiest boot to 'break in' and are relatively light. They seem to be well built, but time will tell. So far I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Old DJ

customer_reviews.title: Deteriorates quickly
customer_reviews.text: With not much usage the laces wore out quickly and broke. After soaking the leather with mink oil, the water resistance was still abysmal and my feet became soaked in the rain. The lace hooks bent easily. I noticed stitching tearing out around where I replaced the laces. Finally, and why I am writing this review, the welting attaching the sole is cracking. All in all, this is a comfortable boot that uses inferior materials.
customer_reviews.author: gZaller

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Not good.The reviews sold me.Not even close,they feel old and worn.My 6yr old wolverines feel better.Maybe I got a bad pair.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and solid
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing right out of box since I received them week ago. Fit perfectly, relieved pressure on my ankles, sturdy and solid! Went to shake the wood chips out after chainsawing and the liners inside were somewhat loose, but I'll keep an eye on them and watch they don't fall out when I shake them. Other than that I love them and will buy another pair soon! Thanks heaps!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Quality value
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my timberland boots (8.5) with these boots. Most of the reviews recommend a size smaller, so I ordered 8 and they fit perfectly. Comfortable and appear to be quality stitching. I am a farmer that is very hard on boots. I walk 2-5 miles every day, get them wet irrigating, hiking in snow and usually only get about a year's service from Carhartt or timberland. These appear to be of the same quality, but I have not had them long enough yet to confirm.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ayarza

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable, Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: You can find the exact same quality boots (maybe even these exact same boots) at Walmart for under $60. It says Oil Resistant, but these boots are very slippery no matter if it's Oil or Water. Also, the rubber sole is flexible, meaning I can bend my boots if enough pressure is applied. My other boots from another well-known brand don't do that and those are actually Oil and Water Resistant. I guess you get what you pay for, which is fine I should've expected that.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: EVER BOOT 1st review
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I was impressed when I got them as far as the quality is concerned. The size and comfort is good too although they came in a half size larger than I ordered but I'll be wearing winter socks for winter use so no problem. What I was happy about was the rubber soul was not that almost plastic stuff you'll see on so many low cost boots which really surprised me considering the low price. I have to say that I would compare these to boots costing 2-3 times as much. The icing on the cake wood be if I looked inside and saw the label saying "made in U.S.A."
customer_reviews.author: Al Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Hard or soft?
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice shoes. Lightweight and good looking. Comfortable but for me, too comfortable. I need support in the footwear. My feet just kind of sloshed around in them and at the end of the day my feet and legs were exhausted. So I tried wearing thicker socks, and gave my feet more time to acclimate to a different feel by continuing to wear these boots. At the end of the third day, my feet are not so tired. I will try some insole pads that are leather and not foam. This is really a problem for me though because I have a hard time with sneakers and running shoes with soft cushioning, I need firm shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Inserts need improvement, better rubber for treads
customer_reviews.text: The insert in these boots is garbage, this is why the boot is 60 bucks. You have to pay 20 bucks for new inserts, which means an 80 dollar pair of boots would be a better investment. The rubber on the treads is soft. I can tell right out of the box that these treads will wear quickly and that did not make me happy. I have a pair of Caterpillar boots I've had for 4 years, tread is still good. The tread on these boots looked just like those Caterpillars but the difference is in material and that is a world of difference. Everboots are more comfortable, but if they wear out quicker, small consolation.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Just spend a little more for better boots.(used in hvac field)
customer_reviews.text: size overall is good. I'm usually somewhere in between 12w to 13. Regular shoes I'm always a 13. Width is perfect for my foot, traction is good and enough room in toes. Cons-might be cause I'm flat footed but the the leather seems to be too big. When tighten, both halves on the laces are touching each other....only about an inch of space. I might try to shrink the leather. The rivets gave me blister.(once) Insoles are not good, bought some replacements and didn't help much. I've had th boots for about 2 months now. I work in hvac
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: No good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a decent made boot, however extremely tight on the top of my foot where the tongue starts. Major pinch zone when walking. Very discomforting. I ordered a size larger than I needed to accommodate ankle supports. Can not even get the boot on when wearingy supports, its so tight on the top my foot. If I remove the braces I can get them on, however it still rubs and pinches the top of my foot. Shame, they did seem like good boots for the price, had they added another 1/2 inch of material for the top of the foot area.
customer_reviews.author: mable

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, but rubber sole came apart in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I want so badly to give these boots 5 stars, because they are incredibly comfortable, and seemed well built. Unfortunately the bottoms of each started to separate within 2 months of use. I had to use an adhesive to glue them back together. I'm not sure if maybe I just got a bad pair? If they had held up, these boots would be 5 stars, as they're more comfortable than the previous pair I had which cost double.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Seems a reasonable boot.
customer_reviews.text: I'll just point out two things: 1) the "open" eyelets are the top ones. I'm not saying that's a bad design but just different, at least for me (it's the reverse of my last pair of boots). For us old people who have a hard time getting our foot up to a level to tie a shoe, that makes getting these boots on tightly a little difficult. 2) I have a history of buying cheap boots. A usual reason why my boots fail is because I end up kicking something and that force separates the toe (leather upper portion) from the sole. I bought these boots because they have some extra stitching through the sole in this toe region.
customer_reviews.author: PaulStLMo

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Really good boots and much more comfortable than I expected considering the price. I bought Caterpillar boots the year before for work and they gave me blisters for 2 months and took that long to break in. These boots never gave me blisters and were broken in after about 2 weeks. Great work boots and not bad for hiking either. Will totally buy these again whenever these ones wear out.
customer_reviews.author: NSmithN

customer_reviews.title: I live in these now.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, so extremely comfortable I hardly want to take them off (usually I can't wait to get my boots off after work). They seem to be wearing great all around, I don't feel like I'm going to slip and slide or anything. I do recommend getting some mink oil or whatever you like for leather treatment/polish because naturally they are going to soak up the first thing you drip on them. 2 days in, and I have a spot of oil right dead center one boot. Still don't want to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable light duty boot. Looks very much like a Wolverine floorhand work boot but with thinner soles and upper leather. Not at all waterproof and will soak through without oil or polish. The positive is that break in is very quick and will tolerate heavy socks. The rubber soles grip well in cold, snow ,and wet conditions. For less than $60 it is a good boot, but not comparable to genuine heavy duty workboots. Good alternative for hikers.
customer_reviews.author: Gwhitebeard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Well I was very surprised, I had recently spent 120 dollars on a pair of boots and then left them on the back of my truck and they fell off, so I had to buy another pair quick and cheap. Bought these and they are a lot more comfortable then the 120 dollar boots I lost. I work construction and after one day they felt like I had been waring them for months. Can't say enough good things about these boots. I hope they keep the price reasonable, because I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: valued customer

customer_reviews.title: Good boot, great price
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble on these boots because I thought the price was low and I didn't think they would be top quality boots. I was wrong. I bought these boots to replace some Timberland's I wore out and they are ever bit as good if not better. They are comfortable and seem to be well made. The only complaint I have is that the speed lace lugs don't hold the lace in while tying the boots, but that's so minor. I heard these boots run big, so I bought my normal shoe size knowing I would be wearing thick socks. They fit perfectly with the thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Bob of Ozarks

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These boots feel pretty darn good out of the box. They fit as they should - sized true in my opinion. They feel like boots that cost more than these. I was hesitant to buy them as they weren't a brand I was familiar with, but I figured that nearly all boots are made in China anyway, so why not give them a try. So far as I can tell, these are Coronavirus free too! My only complaint is that the laces are thin, and don't seem as if they will stand the test of time. I have only had them a few days, so time will tell how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: lucca

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these boots for my husband in a lighter color for work. He is a contractor. He said they fit great and are very comfortable. So much so he asked me to order him a darker colored pair just for everyday use. He has tried many, many different brands of boots in all different price ranges. He said out of all the boots he has had in his 25 years, he thinks these are the most comfortable and the best quality for the price. He is not normally the kind of guy who bothers to comment on shoes or clothing! When it comes time to replace his work pair, we will be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: Ghennel

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, these are the least expensive boots I have ever owned (most are between $165 and $250), but still one of my favorite pairs. These have been on my feet 4 - 5 days a week since May of 2020 and there have been times I really thought I had on a pair of my more expensive boots. Very comfortable and a nice fit for all day wear. OK, not waterproof, but they didn't say they were. Insulated, but not really noticeably so to me. I would buy these again and for a friend. My wife likes her pair, too!
customer_reviews.author: Montana808

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal purchase
customer_reviews.text: My Boyfriend had been complaining about his feet hurting in current work boots. I had done my research on these ever boots and asked about them. He assured me he didnt want the off brand boots. He does very physical work and on his feet all day and comfort is important. I took a chance and purchased the boot thinking if he didnt like i would return. He absolutely loves them!!!!! He says they are extremely comfortable and no need to break in. We bought inner soles just in case but he didnt need them. So we give them 10 👍🏾 Up. No more complaints on feet hurting. Will be purchasing a spare pair as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Inkredibly Me

customer_reviews.title: Quality Boot At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for just over a year now and can say they are durable and very comfortable. I wear them about once to twice a week with no issues noted. My only complaint is the pull tab on the left boot is smaller than the right one and it makes it a little difficult to pull the boot on. This asymmetry may be just on the boots I purchased, but that's why it's getting the 4 star rating. Love these boots and EverBoots is a fantastic company putting out quality boots at great prices. Definitely will buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: No pull loop in the back
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm satisfied. The boots fit well (I've been wearing a 13 for 45 years) and seem to but of decent quality. The price was certainly low. I'm still breaking mine in. The picture shows a pull loop in the back, which it doesn't have. My last pair of work boots didn't have one either, and the padded top tore from repeatedly pulling the boots on by grasping it. Seems like deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.author: pcguy121

customer_reviews.title: They're adequate
customer_reviews.text: I think I have a little sasquatch in me due to the fact that almost every pair of boots or shoes I buy. I either end up splitting the shoes in half or torturing my feet for a year. My last pair of boots were steel toe and once again they were not a good fit. I wore them to work for 6 months and at the end of those 6 months. I lost the toenail on my left pinky toe. So I'm never wearing steel toe boots again. As for these boots, well let's just say they get the job done, until they give up and split in two. Eventually...
customer_reviews.author: Johnsay Riklon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing work boot for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Don't leave reviews too often, but thought this boot deserved it. I've bought several pairs of boots in the same price range and all got returned. Main issues were how uncomfortable the boots were, impossible to walk on them all day long with out some serious pain at the end of the day. These boots feel amazing, zero pain, working 10 hours a day on pavement. As others have said, they do run about a half size smaller then you need. So if you're a size 9, get 8 1/2, etc. For the money though these boots can not be beat!
customer_reviews.author: ScottyDont

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Boot
customer_reviews.text: These boots are well constructed and fit perfectly. My longest foot measurement was 10 1/2 in and I selected my normal 9.5 boot size. Arch support is better than any other boot I have purchased. Normally wear arch supports in other boots but was not required in this boot. Will buy again and highly recommend this boot. Update 01/2020: The customer service from Ever is as awesome as their product. Very quick to respond to questions and went above and beyond my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: domore

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this shoe
customer_reviews.text: These out of the box are a bit stiff, but nothing bad. The fit is spot on, I usually wear wide 4e shoes, that being said, these are wide enough for my feet. That was my main concern so i was very happy that these are not narrow shoes, and they do keep my feet dry. it's not hot to wear so my feet are not a sweaty mess at the end of the day. So far i put them through mud, puddles, dirt, sand, gravel, and horse poop. Time will tell how well they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy soles.
customer_reviews.text: I just started to wear these boots and I am trying to like them. They appear to be well made but the soles are very heavy. For an older guy the less weight you have to drag around with you all day the better. If I knew the boots were this heavy I would not have bought them. The foot bed is comfortable so far and I will wear these but not as much as I would like to. Also there is no pull tab on the back of the boot to help with putting these on. I miss that.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E Keener

customer_reviews.title: well-made and comfortable uppers
customer_reviews.text: They seem well-made, so far, and hopefully will hold up. They fit well, but maybe dont have enough arch support for me, personally, since my feet hurt after a long day, and it is not because they are too tight. Maybe the soles are not cushioned as well as my old pair. This should be something some added insoles can fix so I am not too worried. They rest of the boot is very nice and I have already ordered mink oil to keep them in top shape, since I anticipate having these for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Frmrfran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these boots for a few months now and I have to say I’m done spending the extra money on brand name boots. Very comfortable right out of the box . Now that the colder weather is here they have kept my feet warm better than expected. You can’t beat the price, give these boots a try you won’t be disappointed Up date: 3-22-20 I’ve had these boots for 6 months now and they are holding up beautifully. I’ve worn them 5-6 days a week 40 plus hours with absolutely zero issues. Extremely comfortable. I will never buy another overpriced work boot again.
customer_reviews.author: RealMatthew

customer_reviews.title: Return policy unfortunate
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boots a month ago just stared wearing them a week ago, and I can’t return them even though they don’t fit. There is no return option anywhere. I don’t even want m money back I just want the next size up. Left boot is great, right boot has rubbed my foot raw. I feel like it would be a good boot if the size was correct, and I could exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: very pleased, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Only had these one day, but initial impression is very good. I wore them today already while out in the snow. They fit very comfortably and seem very well made and do not seem light or flimsy. The only thing I noticed between these and a 20 year old pair I finally had to throw away, are that the shoe laces could be a bit beefier and they don't have that loop behind the ankle to help pull them up. But if they last, I am very very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: BrianS

customer_reviews.title: Fits so well!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because my other pair of boots are steel toe boots from Big 5 Sports Store and those sucked! My feet were soooo sore after every shift (I work as an electrician). After the first day of wearing these I was in Heaven. I love the comfort of these shoes! Keep in mind that they say “it’s slightly larger than usual” so if you’re like me and say “I’m typically a 10.5 sometimes an 11” go with the 10.5 size. It fits like a dream. Just know, this review is written after 1 day of use. I have no idea how long these will last me. We’ll see
customer_reviews.author: Nate V

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for the tongue
customer_reviews.text: The boot itself is okay as far as comfort. Unfortunately the tongue ruins the shoe. It is super puffy and makes it hard to tighten the shoe causing the shoe to slip and squeak all day. Unfortunately I will be throwing these shoes out as it is too late to send it back and I did not use them until this last week. I have them two weeks in hopes they got better with some use but they are too uncomfortable as a result of a poor tongue design.
customer_reviews.author: Padrocks

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured and can be dressed up or down. Very nice style and color (true to ad). He wears these often and they aren’t heavyweight so more of a street shoe not work boot. He hates when his feet get hot so this aren’t lined and good for transitional weather but can be worn with thick socks for added warmth. Very well made and look nice with jeans or khakis. This was a great purchase for him especially as the weather changes and sneakers aren’t as durable.
customer_reviews.author: Samar McCann

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair I took pictures next to the first ones I bought 6 months ago. These boots are wonderful, they are light weight and very comfortable. If your think Jesus only 6 months I can explain. I work in a sawmill and walk roughly 9+ miles a day, they took a fair amount of abuse. Running up and down steel stairs and concrete daily for 10 hours or more a day.
customer_reviews.author: Tarren

customer_reviews.title: Had for a few months now and Im hard on shoes
customer_reviews.text: Im blown away. wait.... Phrasing lol Nothing fancy, but comfortable and solid. Unaffected by daily weld splatter, recovers from getting wet, somehow still doesnt smell like an old boot. Pretty much amazed these are this cheap. But then again... There's NOTHING fancy about em. I initially had my doubts but the proofs in the puddin and I will buy these again. (Whenever it is they need replacing that is, because I have been working 10 hour shifts in em and recreating in the snow w em for a couple months now and they are like new)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Quality of Boot and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots! Boots are rather on the large size Quality of leather is excellent practically no wearing in comfortable straight out of the box.I just want to add the customer service alone was worth five stars.I ordered these boots unseen from Germany all emails were answered promptly some times within five minutes! . I provided Everboots with size and brand of my other workboots and explained i will wear them in winter conditions so need to wear thick socks. Based on the recommendation from Ever boots they fit perfectly ! Based on the quality of of dark boots and customer service have ordered again in Tan.I will post again when i have information on lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: expat

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be great boots. They are comfortable, and light weight and the price was right so I took a chance. I'm disappointed that even tho the description says "insulated" they are not. I wish I would have saved my money, paid a little more and bought boots here locally so I knew what I was buying. If you're looking for a decent priced work boot, I'd look at these....but if you're looking for boots to hunt in, work outdoors in....these wouldn't be my first choice
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: The leather appears to be good quality, and the stitching is precise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boots because they are affordable, and I was not expecting much. But these are actually extremely high quality boots. The leather appears to be good quality, and the stitching is precise. The best part is THESE BOOTS ARE REALLY COMFORTABLE. Seriously, these are the most comfortable work boots I've ever worn. I am so impressed with these boot overall, and I would highly recommend these boots to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MLB-LAH

customer_reviews.title: No shock absorption.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are just too light, and after more expensive pairs I can just feel every step in my ankles. If you're a smaller person, or someone who talks about working more than you actually work, these may do the trick. I wanted to try something cheaper because I go through a pair every 3 to 4 months, even if I buy expensive ones. So it was worth a shot, but didn't work out. I'm glad I got them discounted at $40 or I would have been very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Mckillip

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, high quality boots.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fantastic. It only took a few days to break them in, and the cushioned arch support inside has significantly helped my back issues. The soles are rubber so they're great for being non slip when I'm at work in my feet 8 hours a day. These may even double as my hiking boots this summer, which I think have the capacity to do both. I've treated them with mink oil to be extra safe, and they're pretty water proof after I did that. I can't speak to the water resistance before, as I oiled them extra the second I received them. All in all, great product, very versatile, and fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good value, solid boot!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these boots make the cut. They are sturdily built, they are super comfortable, and they have a nice non-slip rubber sole. I bought these specifically because I wanted boots for motorcycling. I wanted something that was sturdy enough to handle that, but also looked good. Because I am more of a weekend rider, I can't speak to whether or not they withstand daily use, but I don't see why they wouldn't and they have certainly met my expectations at this point. And for $55 - if they last through 2 seasons of riding, I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Casimiro

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these boots for 1/2 the price that he was spending on those other boots and he fell in love with them and threw all the other boots in ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband was always going out buying those expensive (over priced) boots because someone else had them and he would come home barely walking. I purchased these boots for 1/2 the price that he was spending on those other boots and he fell in love with them and threw all the other boots in the trash and he said Baby from now on you buy all my boots, these are the most comfortable boots I have had since I've been working
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot at a Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Really great boot for the cost. Looks good, feels good, and can be worn all day. Not too heavy either. The only cons are that the lacing seems to always irritate my ankles no matter how I tie the boot and that the heel has some sort of cushion system that is bubbled out and runs my heel wrong for the first few minutes
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my husband, who is really hard to buy shoes for without first trying them on. After reading the reviews I chose a 7 M - and they fit perfectly! He said they are super comfortable. Now we shall see how long they last. I've bought him Timberlind over the years and the soles literally come apart with a few months (once it was 3rd time wearing). Hopefully we will have better luck.. but they appear as if they are going to last him. He uses them for landscaping our home - we have a property with acreage - so lots to do all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Woody

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOOT BUY EVER!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is in construction and Very hard on boots. Even with the$100+ boots (which I have bought Many of) they Never last a year (6mo is norm) before the seams and soles blow out. Bought a pair of these LAST year and they are still in excellent shape! Not only does he say they are very comfortable but The toe stiching is Amazing! Bought another pair this year (and 1 for the grandson) just to make sure he has another pair for whenever last years finally give in! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sissy M.

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these boots. I have boots that cost me a lot more $$$ that don't fit and feel as nice. I have foot problems and need arch and ankle support. I put heel pads inside and it made them feel great. Seem to be well constructed too, although I won't be using them for rough duty. Sometimes I get lucky ordering boots and shoes via mail, this was one of those times. Thanks..
customer_reviews.author: Normie G

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep feet warm in New England winter weather.
customer_reviews.text: Good indoor boot. But as far as insulated ? I would not agree with. They do not keep feet warm while working outdoors during new England weather. Definitely not an insulated winter boot.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Molina

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots, Too big though.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, comfortable boots. Bought them for my boyfriend. He does landscaping and wears them all day, 13+ hours and he says they feel great and are good quality. Only downside I had to order 2 pairs (returned the first pair very easy). He fits a 7.5 and the 7.5 size of these boots were more like a size 9. I ordered him 6.5 and they were still too big but worked with thick socks. I would order 1.5 size smaller than your usual size if you want a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Ever Boots Men’s Work Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn this pair of boots now for a few full days of work, but I can already tell that they are solid. They feel comfortable and provide solid protection for my feet when doing all sorts of work. The company sent a pair of additional insoles for added support if needed, which I have used and enjoy. I am confident that these boots will hold up over time and at the price, how can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: sizes vary between venders
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels great. Only had them on for a week so far but like them. Coming from former Redwings brand. Turned out that my Redwings were wore through the heels and must have been the inexpensive models and could not resole. I did switch my redwing inersoles and worked out with minor trimming around the front of the foot. These are a little tighter but this works great. very comfortable and not too tight. Just week from having toenail removed and careful insterting my foot. cannot talk of long term use yet. K. G. Magann Retired
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Magann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The boots fit perfectly right out of t, and they appear to be sturdy and well made. My goal was to find not only a good work boot, but one useful for hiking and motorcycle riding. Boots specifically for those purposes were quite a bit more expensive, but I believe these are tougher. If you want an all-purpose boot, that looks pretty good and won't break the bank, I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: John Amigo

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought wolverine for years, always at $125.00 plus, and they only last a year. So just thought I'd try these due to the price is half. I've been presently surprised. After 3 months the boots are really holding up and are comfortable. I always had a complaint on wolverine, there laces were terable, always fell apart after 4 months. Laces on these boots..much, much better. Would recommend these boots
customer_reviews.author: Dave M. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these boots now for about 2 years. For all intents and purposes, they're still wearable. Fairly worn bottoms, a little cracking in the soles where the foot bends, but still weather tight and these will become my general purpose outdoor boots, for working in the garden and such. Really the best boots for the price, at least when I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Proctor

customer_reviews.title: About half a size too large.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are comfortable right out of the box. They took no time to break in. I'm usually a size 13 to 14 depending on the manufacturer. But these boots were still a little big at size 13. It might be smart to order half a size smaller than your usual. The color was originally somewhat reddish, but once mink oil is applied the leather turns a dark brown. The tongues of the boots are rough leather, so mink oil cannot be applied there. The boots are pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Farce Fry

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping for better
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. Loves the way they looked and feel on the first wear. However he walks a lot throughout the day (average 13k steps per day) and he’s only been wearing them for a month and they’re already starting to hurt his feet after consecutive days of long walking. We were hoping they’d last closer to six months :/ possible a better show for someone who doesn’t walk so much.
customer_reviews.author: raising.clarks

customer_reviews.title: I work 10+ hrs days and first two three months they were great, after that
customer_reviews.text: 6 Month Review: These boots are more for fashion than for work. I work 10+ hrs days and first two three months they were great, after that, I had to replace so many insoles because i couldn't bare the pain. Soles are completely worn out on the front, the back still has a little meat left. Leather needs constant maintenance, make sure to use a water protectant cause it it gets rained on, the leather looks baaaaad.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Smelly
customer_reviews.text: I can feel the lugs of the sole through the sole, like 3/4' rock with worn out tennis shoes. The off gassing of the sole is so strong I keep the boots outside at night. Outside of that I like the bigger fit and the look.
customer_reviews.author: Orville Blair

customer_reviews.title: good budget comfortable reliable workboot
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something reliable and cheaper price to replace my timberland work boot and I had found this on my research. it's as same as the description it runs little bigger than the Tim but I still ordered the same size as my Tim and I try it on today at work and yes had it on whole 9 hours work so far so good. but the packing are little poopoo box came damaged but that doesn't matter because I need the boot for work not the box so I did recommend this to the people who need a Budget workboot.
customer_reviews.author: Fishyyy Tan

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable work shoes I've ever owned. Buy them u won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.text: In a word - WOW!!! These are hands down the best work boots I have ever owned. I worked on concrete for 4 hours there day I got them and my feet and knees didn't hurt at all. They seem to be very durable and strong but will update review in 6 months or so. Absolutely awesome! Price was great and they look to be out together much better than a pair of wolverines I bought a while back. The wolverines fell apart in less than a year and cost way more.
customer_reviews.author: BigTravG

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable without break-in, accurate sizing
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable work boots I've ever owned. I don't work construction any longer, so these are only for home projects, but I've owned quite a few boots over the years. These are soft on the feet yet seem fairly supportive on the ankle and have just enough arch support. I wear an 11 with mid-wide foot and these fit perfectly and true to size.
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Check quality upon receipt (look for bunched fabric in heel)
customer_reviews.text: The boots I received had an extra bunch of fabric in one of the boots rear seams. I’m attaching a photo to this review. This bunch of fabric is very uncomfortable. I’m hoping this is a defect - I’ve ordered a replacement. I’ll update this review once the new ones are received. UPDATE: I received a new pair. They do NOT have this extra bunch of fabric. These are nice boots. Not the absolute most comfortable I've owned, but pretty good. Updating my rating to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron O

customer_reviews.title: Nice fitting, comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10.5 boots. Ordered these in 10.5 and they fit perfectly. I had a pair of Timberland Pro boots that began leaking after the sole to boot connection let go. I will say the Timberlands lasted 8 years but I still never had a pair of boots where the sole just about fell off. These Ever Boots seem to be well made and were a bargain price! I'll update in 8 years!
customer_reviews.author: GMC

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and a little large.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable from the moment I put them on. I wear a size 10 in everything, however, I read what others had written about being a little large and went with the 9.5 and that was perfect. A size 10 would have been too large. I have worn them several times for a full day and they were great. Good fit and good traction. Probably would not be the best for too cold of climates but for some FL working they fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: I don't really wear boots much but these seem good
customer_reviews.text: Ordered them because I don't own any other shoes that cover the ankle and I needed to meet that requirement. I've only worn them twice so far they seem fine, unsure on longevity or if it would even mean much from me since I just need them for a weekend and after that I'll probably only wear these for yard work or something. I ordered them at my shoe size and I'd say the fit is spot on length wise, and feel a little wide. But I think I could probably have tightened the laces enough to offset that, so it may go away after I've worn them a few times.
customer_reviews.author: sackey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, stylish and durable work boots.
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish and comfortable boots. I've only wore them a couple of times, but they appear well made and very durable. I had to stomp around in mud for half a day. My feet never got wet or cold. The boots cleaned up nicely with warm water and a brush. I think they are a good value for the money. I'm quite happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: pbroberts

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!  I encourage you to size down one.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I did find that you should size down one. My son wears an 8 and we sized down to a 7.5, which was still a tad too big. The insole is super soft and they do include the original sole if you don't care for the extra cushion. The color is a nice brown and the toes are hard for protection. Very satisfied with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Whee

customer_reviews.title: Decent and affordable
customer_reviews.text: For the amount I spent, these boots are incredible. They are light weight, flexible, and comfortable. They broke in very well, and in a very short time. My only complaints are that first the leather is very soft and thin, so durability seems like it'd be an issue, it scratches easily. Second, they don't seem to water proof very well. I have been oiling and spray treating these, the seams but they appear to let water in anyway. Otherwise, as I said before, they are great boots, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good boots on a budget
customer_reviews.text: These boots appear to be made very similar to many of the "name brand" chinese built boots. I am a diesel mechanic and these have held up well after one month of use. They are tight across the top if the foot, I had to put some keen thin insoles in them to adjust the fit. I will probably go back to Wolvurine on my next pair.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Slip resistance
customer_reviews.text: They look great. They fit to the size I'm 10.5 and when it was time to put them for work in a slippery environment like meat departments they do slip a little. Kinda like skiing picture shadow the hedgehog or subway sufers ...kinda like you slopping thru the water. Yes it's a little anti slip but don't depend on it to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowwalker

customer_reviews.title: They look good & feel good.
customer_reviews.text: These boots were very easy to break in, fit well & look good. I'm pleased with them so far. That being said, I've only had them for a week, so I've no idea how they'll stand up to the rigors of farm life, nor how long they'll last; but as I said: so far, I'm pleased with them. They're true to my US shoe size, they're comfortable, they're reasonably priced & they look good. Based on my experience, I'd recommend them to anyone. Regards, B.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: An alright boot
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. The boots are very comfortable, but are a little large. After wear they started fitting wider. I bought a 10.5, and at first they fit perfectly. I decided to buy a 10 to see if they fit better, and they were too small. Overall I would recommend them at this time. ***** Update: I have owned the boots maybe a month now with little wear, and the stitching is coming undone from the tongue of the boot. Also where the boot and sole meet it is coming undone, and a stringy substance is coming out from under the boot.
customer_reviews.author: jcofield91

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I usually have an extensive break-in period for shoes, but these were comfortable from the first time worn. I usually wear 12.5 to 13 in most boots, but size 12 in these even with athletic socks fit just fine. I have just ordered a second pair for outside my work since the first pair shows the results of construction usage. The quality so far has far surpassed my expectations!! Good quality leather. Real stitching. Real value. My last pair of inexpensive boots fell apart after a few months and my $200 boots aren't as good as the EverBoot.
customer_reviews.author: William W. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: These boots are well worth it. They have over exceeded my expectations. The pictures I have attached are from well over a year of almost daily use. I work in a warehouse environment so I think they have held up fairly well. The only thing, but this would happen really to any shoe I think if used as much as these things have, is the insoles wore out. I just pop them out and put some new ones in and good as new. I expect another year or two out of these boats. 👍
customer_reviews.author: D. Hdez

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful boots.  Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 12 and that's what I ordered. They fit fine, though I did add a pair of gel inserts. Now the boots fit like a glove. Tongue is sewn to lining neatly, seam hidden. Interior upper above toes is padded. I read about goodyear welting, which increases durability but could also increase price and reduce comfort. Not here. Boot are comfortable and economical. You could pay much, much more and not get quality this good. If boots have problems later, I will definitely amend this. I never heard of Ever. Who cares. The product is quality. (Yep, made in China. Welcome to the real world.)
customer_reviews.author: Bernard in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good boot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to the Sequoias, mainly to trudge around easy trails since I'm old. I expected them to hurt, and they did not! They fit exactly as indicated; I've got a small foot 6.5 and the lace up done proper was just perfect. I didn't expose them to water but I suspect they'd be okay there. They look good in the darker leather, and I was very pleased for the price I paid. Another good value!!
customer_reviews.author: Photographer AdvocateTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for the price, wear out really fast
customer_reviews.text: I went through two pair, each wearing out in about 4 months. The soles in particular are made of something kinda cheap and the heels wore down almost immediately (not my experience with other boots). If you work in an indoor shop/wood floors, or other light duty environment they will probably be fine
customer_reviews.author: clevernonsense

customer_reviews.title: We love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my 13 year old son he wears a size 11 in men the boots look great and he like them too they have a cushion in the front at the top that I've never saw in any other boots and the gold around the shoelaces are just awesome, at first he wanted Timberland boots but I'm not sure what the tree means so I decided to allow him to surf the web for more options. These Boots Are Better Than Timberland boots & We are satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Really love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I am not in the construction business, so to be fair I don't live in my boots. I wear them occasionally, especially for snow shoveling and bad weather. They've kept my foot warm and dry, which was the reason I bought them. I like that they're not too heavy and they're well balanced. Best of all, you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Mattei

customer_reviews.title: Only Issue Tie Box too tight
customer_reviews.text: These are High Quality, and Well Made. I ordered them in my Normal size 9.5 M. The Width and Length were Perfect fit me True to Size. The Reason for 4 Star review is that the Toe Box was too narrow and Pinched my Toes. I Returned them only for that Reason, insole was Very Nice and Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good deal so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had to put insoles in because I stand all day. But they are comfy. After wearing for a few weeks they are okay. They are a bit heavy but they are work boots. They are a little hard to get on because of the sewn in tongue but are still okay to wear all day. Not sure I would buy again though. Wish they were more insole cushion for standing on cement 10-12 hours. After wearing for several months I do like these boots. I can go most days not even knowing I am in work boots. Very comfortable with my own added insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Kneppelt

customer_reviews.title: Good first impression, but I was fooled
customer_reviews.text: These boot fit true to size. I’ve only had them a few weeks so long term use is unknown. There was very little break in time, by the second day they felt like my old boots. The soles seem durable. The leather does not seem as stiff as other boots I’ve owned, it is very flexible and soft. I am looking forward to seeing these boots lasting me a full work season. Update 5-12-2020 These boots are junk. Soak up water like a sponge, very weak support in ankle. Hard to keep laces tight. They are being sent back right away.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Holman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are actually leather, as advertised, which is more than I can say for other boots I've bought on Amazon. They fit well. They keep his feet warm and dry. After ten months the boots blew out, but I never expect any footwear, no matter how pricey, to last longer than a year for my husband. Their insoles began to deteriorate almost immediately, but we replaced them with some Dr. Scholl's, so that was no real problem. He likes these well enough that he asked me to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily K. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Hey Mikey he likes it LOL
customer_reviews.text: Wow oh wow my hubby LOVES THEM ! Has a construction Worker he needs sturdy and waterproof boots !!! And the price was right LOL .. , They arrived today with no problems with delivery ! if anyone wants to know about them a little more give me about two weeks and I’ll tell you how comfortable how well they are and how sturdy it is :-)
customer_reviews.author: debbiedee65

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I go through a pair of work boots every 6 months so I am happy with these boots Very comfortable boot the insoles that are included are not half bad but I replace the insoles in all my boots no matter the price. I have been wearing these for a week now and my feet feel like they would if I purchased a $150.00 pair of boots.
customer_reviews.author: David Chapman

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleasantly surprised by how mich I like them. Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I always have several pairs of work boots around in wet, colder weather, I bought these because a pair of Lugz boots failed me after minimal work usage and I needed another pair for the rotation. They are very affordable, comfortable. and holding up well. If they make it through spring in one piece, I will definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura  S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to put on and take off - an excellent bargain
customer_reviews.text: I put these boots on right out of the box and did nine straight hours of hot, hard, and heavy work. At the end of the day they were as comfortable as my running shoes. One other excellent point about these boots: they are easy to get on and off - a real plus if you’re working out in the yard and need to come inside from time to time. Great quality at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Carl D. Hausman

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Initially these were amazing. After only 6 months they are falling apart and water is getting inside. They are worn for landscape work and based off the description we dud think they would last longer. We haven’t had a pair of work boots crumble apart in the inside before. Will not get these again. Would rather spend another 20 and have boots that last twice as long.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Shoes WAY Smaller Than USA Sizing - Made in CHINA
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these boots, but had no idea they were so small, I could not even insert a 'socked foot' inside the boot! Then I find they're made in China, which apparently uses extremely small sizing charts. Had to Return these Boots when I needed Boots the most. I would also recommend you order the Wider sizing even if you don't usually wear a Wide. Disappointed to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: M.J. B.

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: These boots are my most comfortable shoes. I have a lot of foot pain wearing my other shoes and boots. The leather is nice, and they are sturdy. I will probably buy another pair before winter, just in case they decide to change or not carry them anymore. I wear a women's 10.5, so ordered an 8.5 in these, perfect fit. My husband hates to see me wear them, they aren't "cute" but when your feet hurt, you don't worry about cute.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Loose lace Hooks
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are acceptable casual boots for the price, but they aren't combat quality nor would I consider them work quality. The first thing to go bad on these were the lace hooks which didn't last two week before the became loose. they are still attached but spin and bend easily making lacing and unlacing a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

product_meta.title: EVER BOOTS "Tank Men's Soft Toe Oil Full Grain Leather Work Boots Construction Rubber Sole
feature_bullets: Offers 3 MONTH MANUFACTURE WARRANTY, Check Product Description for details
Goodyear Welt Construction offers Durability for Industrial Construction Concrete Safety Contractor
Comfort Cushion Insole with Removable Option Slip Resistant Rubber Outsole Bullet Point
Speedy Hooks for Easy Wearing and Steel Shank Alleviate Pressure
True Size as Timberlands and Caterpillars More Sizing Detail under Product Description
